column4: btw who else thinks that synaptic UI sucks and is absolutely non intuitive?
anything can be easily confiduing for newbies..... we can't baby sit them though.... not that much.
I don't agree with you but it's just my opinion
if you want to provide linux desktop for all - and target is 'everyone' then you have to provide something for 'dumb' users too
personally I don't care - my favourite tool is ion3 and emacs and I don't like all these sweet candy gnome/kde things
but I also have customers and I try to replace windows with ubuntu on their desktops
and these users are for example 40-50 yr old managers used to windows/office/excel things.. they don't have will and time to learn things they don't need
sometimes it is not their choice
in that case they don't need linux.
ok go to your 'virtual' world and live in your linux gurus clan forver
in the real world it is very often that your employer want's to reduce cost
you dont know me, or what i am like. WHo are you to speak to anybody you don't know anything ?
and voila you get brand new laptop for your work but suprise - no windows - just ubuntu and open office
then stop to talk like 'linux guru' from dark ages ;)
today linux goes on desktops and goes to everyone so it has to be _easy_
